title: Enjoying retirement, lads? 10 former footballers who piled on the pounds when they finished playing
text:
Sport Enjoying retirement, lads? 10 former footballers who piled on the pounds when they finished playing As pictures of Nineties icon Jose Luis Chilavert show him looking a little 'different', we celebrate the former stars who have proudly piled it on post-football Share Some stars who have chosen to enjoy life in retirement (Photo: AFP/Getty/Get Reading) Share Get daily   Could   
Remember Jose Luis Chilavert? 
If you were watching international football in the late 1990s, you almost certainly do. Chiolavert was the colourful, charismatic Paraguay goalkeeper who used to take attacking free-kicks and penalties. 
In fact, Chilavert - who played for his nation at both the 1998 and 2002 World Cups - scored eight goals for his country. He even banged in a hat-trick for one of his clubs. Jose-Luis Chilavert, Paraguay goalkeeper, goalscorer, skipper and general legend (Photo: Allsport) 
As his unique goalscoring exploits suggest, the legendary goalkeeper is clearly a man who likes to enjoy life to the full. 
So, perhaps we shouldn't be too surprised that now, at the age of 51, Chilavert looks a little, er… bigger than he used to: Jose Luis Chilavert, as he looks today (Photo: YouTube/Hinchada Fortinera) 
In fairness to 'The Bulldog' (as he was once known), most footballers tend to gain a bit of weight once their playing careers come to an end. After all, as a player, you are training every day and having your diet monitored by nutritionists. Once you retire, you are free to do as little exercise as you like… and eat as much as you like. 
For most former stars, this means some inevitable weight gain. Unfortunately, some footballers add a little more timber than others - as the changes in these fine gentlemen demonstrate… (Original) Ronaldo
